Award.AwardTitle: CICI: Regional: SAC-PA: Towards Security Assured Cyberinfrastructure in Pennsylvania

Directorate.LongName: Direct For Computer & Info Scie & Enginr

Award.AbstractNarration:
Cybersecurity is a growing concern for individuals, communities, nations and the world. The increasing numbers of cyber attacks make cybersecurity a critical national security concern. Information technology provides tremendous opportunities to accelerate data-driven scientific research and education. Increasing cybersecurity problems can adversely impact scientific research and its economic and social benefits if the cyberinfrastructure that supports scientific research and education is not well protected. Beyond the implementation of innovative cybersecurity solutions, it is critical to establish structured and effective practices and better collaboration among various stakeholders to share cybersecurity resources, expertise and information. This project focuses on establishing a regional collaboration and partnership within the state of Pennsylvania, referred to as SAC-PA. SAC-PA provides critical support to smaller academic institutions, including resource constrained regional institutions that serve under-represented populations as well as high school teachers and students. It establishes a collaboration and partnership framework to enable concerted activities promoting the use of effective cybersecurity techniques and practices inherent in security-assured cyberinfrastructure. While enhancing the cybersecurity posture of Pennsylvania, SAC-PA provides a regional cybersecurity collaboration and partnership model that can be adopted by other regions, or be extended to national-level collaborations.

The SAC-PA project includes participation from both the public and private sectors and academic institutions in PA. The following key activities are planned: (i) developing and delivering three regional workshops in Pittsburgh to bring together regional stakeholders from scientific research communities along with cyberinfrastructure or cybersecurity resources to better understand the regional capabilities; explore existing and emerging cybersecurity challenges/solutions; and devise collaboration and partnerships to enable concerted cybersecurity activities to promote the use of effective cybersecurity techniques and practices; (ii) collaboratively developing training/awareness materials based on the needs and capabilities identified in the workshops, and sharing these extensively with regional partners and beyond through various channels; and (iii) establishing regional partnerships and a shared repository of cybersecurity resources/capabilities to facilitate collaborative and concerted efforts towards protecting scientific cyberinfrastructure. The project leverages capabilities of LERSAIS, an NSA/DHS designated Center of Academic Excellence and Research (CAE/CAE-R), University of Pittsburgh faculty members, University of Pittsburgh?s Computing Services and Systems Department, local partners with an excellent track record of collaboration in cybersecurity capacity building, education and research projects, and the established NSF CyberCorp program at the University of Pittsburgh.

POR.DRECONTENT:
Project Goals: The major goal of this project was to establish/foster regional collaboration and partnership within the state of Pennsylvania, referred to as SAC-PA (Security Assured Cyberinfrastructure in Pennsylvania). SAC-PA’s objective was thus to bring together researcher, Cybersecurity professionals, cyberinfrastructure providers, educators from the state to share and discuss cybersecurity challenges, resources, and solutions; it also aimed at providing support to smaller academic institutions (schools and colleges, etc.) including resource-constrained regional institutions that serve under-represented groups, women and high school teachers and students. The project aimed to establish/foster collaboration and partnership to enable activities promoting the use of effective cybersecurity techniques and practice of security-assured cyberinfrastructure. The key activities proposed for this major goal included:

  • develop and deliver regional workshops focused on security-assured cyberinfrastructure;
  • collaboratively develop training/awareness materials;
  • establish regional partnerships and a shared repository of cybersecurity resources/capabilities.

Summary of Outcomes:

Within the two-year period of the project, two 2-day workshops were organized where a diverse group of speakers and participants were engaged in discussion and networking. These workshops focused on:

  • Presentations/discussions from different sectors that provide cyberinfrastructure/cybersecurity services/resources that primarily focus on research and education within Pennsylvania, primarily, and also from outside PA. This was related to the goal of identifying various Cybersecurity/Cyberinfrastructure resources available and how they may be available for sharing by the broader community for research and education while understanding the Cybersecurity needs.
  • Participation from broader communities within PA that have interests in learning and using cyberinfrastructure resources/services with a focus on cybersecurity. This included a goal to bring together, researchers, practitioners, experts from industry within the topic of Cyberinfrastructure and Cybersecurity to foster broader interactions and exchange of information/knowledge and Cybersecurity awareness.
  • Fostering interactions and collaborations among a diverse set of stakeholders by facilitating networking/collaboration opportunities within the workshop. 

The first workshop, SAC-PA1 Workshop, was held on June 22-23, 2017. Workshop information including the presentation schedule and speaker details are available at http://www.sis.pitt.edu/lersais/research/sac-pa/ws1/index.html.

The second workshop, SAC-PA2 Workshop, was held in June 14-15, 2018. Workshop information including the presentation schedule and speaker details are available at http://www.sis.pitt.edu/lersais/research/sac-pa/ws2/index.html)

Overall, the SAC-PA workshops brought together experts from various sectors -- educational institutions, public and private sectors - to share information about various cyberinfrastructure and cybersecurity resources available in the region, cybersecurity challenges/practices, general cybercrime investigation issues, as well some ongoing research activities, and best practices. The presenters represented researchers, practitioners, cybersecurity/policy leaders of institutes/organizations, industry, etc.

Several participants/speakers in the workshops represented researchers and IT/Cybersecurity experts from many educational institutions; many of the participants were also from smaller institutions. Various educational institutions represented in the two workshops included:

  • Duquesne University, Gannon University, Community College of Allegheny County, California University of PA, Indiana University of PA, Lafayette College, LaSalle University, Robert Morris University, Seton Hill University, Shippensburg University, Point Park University, Bucks County Community College, Montgomery County Community Colleges, Chatham University, Duquesne University, City Charter High School. Carnegie Mellon University, Indiana University, NSF/Rutgers University, University of Chicago, Pennsylvania State University, University of Pittsburgh, 

Speakers and participants also represented other Cyberinfrastructure/Cybersecurity related entities (Industry and providers) included:

  • IBM, Palo Alto, Splunk, University of Pittsburgh Medical Center, Jersey Shore Health System, Butler Health System, SEI-CERT, NCFTA, PittCyber, Internet2, KW2 Associates, Pittsburgh Quantum Institute, Pittsburgh Supercomputing Center, University of Pittsburgh Center for Research Computing, Center for Trustworthy Scientific Computing (Trusted CI), Open Science Grid, XSEDE

 

The presentations and other tutorials and cybersecurity awareness materials have been made available at the SAC-PA website: http://www.sis.pitt.edu/lersais/research/sac-pa/index.html. A draft SAC-PA collaboration and partnership framework document has also been created. Information about other resources related to Cyberinfrastructure and Cybersecurity within Pennsylvania (as well as some outside) have been made available at the website.
